FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_prev_prog_3.Description: The CF Industries Nitrogen, LLC facility has a comprehensive Process Safety Management (PSM) Program and is subject to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's standard for process safety management of hazardous chemicals found at 29CFR Part 1910.119. Key elements of the PSM program include: 1) Stringent design standards of equipment which incorporate substantial safety factors. 2) Extensive process safety information that is accurate and up to date. 3) Well trained personnel who operate and maintain the facility. 4) Written operating and maintenance procedures. 5) Mechanical Integrity procedures of process equipment inspectionsand quality control. 6) Management of change and pre-startup review procedures. 7) Periodic, detailed evaluation of all covered process areas by a team utilizing HAZOP methodology. 8) Regular audits of the PSM program. 9) Employee participation in every element of the PSM program. The Yazoo City Plant process is nitrogen fertilizer manufacturing which consist of thirteen interconnected and co-located production/storage units. These units have similar prevention program elements and are listed together in Section 7.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES 

Operating in a safe and responsible manner is a core value and an integral part of CF Industries. Our safety strategy revolves around our "Do It Right" value and permeates our business in three key ways:

?    Robust systems that provide a clear, repeatable direction toward excellence.

?    Superior performance that aligns effective and efficient EHS activities with operations.

?    Engaged culture that empowers consistent behaviors that drive toward excellence.

CF Industries works closely with emergency responders and other local officials to develop detailed emergency response plans that extend beyond our physical operating locations.



YAZOO CITY NITROGEN FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Yazoo City Nitrogen Facility manufactures anhydrous ammonia, nitric acid, urea-ammonium nitrate solutions, urea liquor, diesel exhaust fluid (urea liquor), ammonium nitrate solutions, and ammonium nitrate (solid). Intermediates in the manufacture of these products include ammonia, CO2, nitric acid and urea. The regulated only substance, as defined by 40 CFR Part 68, which are present at the facility in more than a threshold quantity is ammonia.



THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

The Yazoo City Nitrogen Facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with all of the accidental release and chemical-specific prevention requirements as set forth in U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) 40 CFR Part 68. This facility is also subject to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard 29 CFR 1910.119. The following summarizes the elements of the release and chemical-specific prevention that are in place at our facility:

?    Process safety information that is accurate and up to date;

?    Well-trained operating, maintenance, and contract personnel;

?    Written operating procedures;

?    Mechanical inte

t the ERP.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Rigorous training, drills, audits, cooperation with emergency responders and local officials, recognition programs and participation in industry safety initiatives help keep our focus on what it takes to "Do It Right." Through our ongoing commitment to make our facility as safe as possible for employees, contractors, the community, and the environment, we are always continuously improving our systems and practices.
